com.samysadi.acs.service.checkpointing.checkpoint

Interface Checkpoint<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of the RunnableEntity for which the checkpoint was created
    P - the type of the Entity which is used as a parent for newly created RunnableEntity during the recovery process
    All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Entity, Notifier, Probed, UncloneableEntity
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    VmCheckpoint
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CheckpointAbstract, VmCheckpointAbstract, VmCheckpointDefault

    public interface Checkpoint<E extends RunnableEntity,P extends Entity>
extends UncloneableEntity
    A checkpoint is a snapshot of the running state of a RunnableEntity at a given moment of the simulation.
    After that a checkpoint is created and updated, it can then be used at any other moment of the simulation to create a copy of the RunnableEntity which was used to update the checkpoint. The copy will have the same state as the original RunnableEntity at the moment when the checkpoint was last updated (see getCheckpointTime()).

    The parent of the checkpoint is the RunnableEntity for which it was created. The parent is used as the source for updating the checkpoint when the update() method is called. You can safely change the parent of the checkpoint as long as the checkpoint is not busy (isCheckpointBusy()). The new parent will be used for next updates.

    A MemoryZone must be set for each checkpoint. See setMemoryZone(MemoryZone) and getMemoryZone() for more information.

    Three main methods are offered by this interface. The update(), recover(Entity, RunnableEntity), and copy(MemoryZone).
    Have a look at their respective documentation for more information.

    Since:
    1.2

    • Method Detail

      • getParent

        E getParent()
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Returns the parent of this entity, or null if no parent is set
        Specified by:
        getParent in interface Entity
        Returns:
        the parent of this entity, or null

      • getMemoryZone

        MemoryZone getMemoryZone()
        Returns the MemoryZone which is used by the checkpoint (i.e. the MemoryZone where the checkpoint is saved).
        Returns:
        the MemoryZone where the checkpoint is saved

      • setMemoryZone

        void setMemoryZone(MemoryZone zone)
        Updates the MemoryZone of the checkpoint.

        The delete() method is first called before the new zone is set. This means that after changing the MemoryZone, any saved state in the checkpoint will be lost.
        Use copy(MemoryZone) to copy the checkpoint to another MemoryZone without losing the saved state.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if canDelete() returns false.

      • getCheckpointTime

        long getCheckpointTime()
        Returns the simulation time corresponding to the moment when the state of the parent runnable entity was last checkpointed.
        Returns:
        the simulation time when this checkpoint was updated or a negative value if the checkpoint has never been updated

      • isCheckpointStateSet

        boolean isCheckpointStateSet(byte state)
        Tests if the given state is set and returns true if it is and false if it is not.

        See CHECKPOINT_STATE_UPDATING, CHECKPOINT_STATE_RECOVERING and CHECKPOINT_STATE_COPYING for possible values for the state parameter.

        A NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_STATE_CHANGED notification is thrown when the state of the checkpoint changes.

        Parameters:
        state - the state to be tested
        Returns:
        true if the given state is set, and false otherwise.

      • isCheckpointBusy

        boolean isCheckpointBusy()
        Returns true if the checkpoint is being used.

        If you need to check single state, then use isCheckpointStateSet(byte) instead.

        Returns:
        true if the checkpoint is being used

      • canUpdate

        boolean canUpdate()
        Returns true if the checkpoint can be updated.

        This method returns false in the following situations:

        • The checkpoint has no defined parent RunnableEntity;
        • The parent RunnableEntity has terminated (e.g. failed);
        • The checkpoint has no set MemoryZone or it is not usable;
        • There is an active process using the checkpoint: either an update, a recovery or a copy (see isCheckpointBusy());
        • Other implementation-specific reasons that may prevent the update.
        Returns:
        true if the checkpoint can be updated

      • update

        void update()
        This method updates the checkpoint. After the update the checkpoint will reflect the state of its parent RunnableEntity at the current simulation time.

        The parent RunnableEntity may be paused at any moment of the update, and it is resumed once the update is finished.

        During the update, the state CHECKPOINT_STATE_UPDATING is set. Once the update is finished, either a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_UPDATE_SUCCESS notification or a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_UPDATE_ERROR notification is thrown depending on if the checkpoint was updated and acknowledged successfully or not.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if canUpdate() returns false.

      • cancelUpdate

        void cancelUpdate()
        Cancels an ongoing update.

        You need to listen to appropriate notifications to know when the update is completed (canceled or succeeded)

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the checkpoint is not being updated (see isCheckpointStateSet(byte))

      • canRecover

        boolean canRecover(P parent,
                 E toReplace)
        Returns true if the checkpoint can be used for recovery with the given parameters.

        This method returns false in the following situations:

        • The checkpoint has no defined parent RunnableEntity;
        • The checkpoint has no set MemoryZone or it is not usable;
        • The checkpoint was never updated and there is no saved state to use for recovery;
        • There is an active update process which is modifying the checkpoint (see isCheckpointStateSet(byte));
        • The given parent entity cannot be used (it has no parents, it / or one of its parents has failed, it / or one of its parents is powered off);
        • Other implementation-specific reasons that may prevent the recovery.
        Parameters:
        parent - the entity which will be used as a parent for the newly created RunnableEntity during the recovery process (might be null, in which case no tests relative to this param is done)
        toReplace - the RunnableEntity to replace if the recovery process is successful (might be null, in which case no tests relative to this param is done)
        Returns:
        true if the checkpoint can be used for recovery using the given parameters

      • recover

        void recover(P parent,
           E toReplace)
        Uses the checkpoint data to create a new RunnableEntity that has the same state as the parent RunnableEntity when the checkpoint was last updated.

        The newly created RunnableEntity is defined as a child of the given parent entity. And all necessary resources are allocated for the newly created RunnableEntity on the parent entity.

        If the toReplace entity is given and is not null, then we first remove that entity before trying to allocate new resources for the newly created RunnableEntity. Note, however, that if the recovery process fails, then the toReplace entity is not removed.

        During the recovery, the state CHECKPOINT_STATE_RECOVERING is set. Once the recovery is finished, either a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_RECOVER_SUCCESS notification or a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_RECOVER_ERROR notification is thrown depending on if the recovery process was successful or not.

        Parameters:
        parent - the entity which is used as a parent for the newly created RunnableEntity during the recovery process
        toReplace - the RunnableEntity to replace if the recovery process is successful (might be null)
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if canRecover(Entity, RunnableEntity) returns false

      • cancelRecover

        void cancelRecover()
        Cancels an ongoing recovery.

        You need to listen to appropriate notifications to know when the recover is completed (canceled or succeeded)

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the checkpoint is not being used for recovery (see isCheckpointStateSet(byte))

      • canCopy

        boolean canCopy(MemoryZone zone)
        Returns true if the checkpoint can be copied to the given zone.

        This method returns false in the following situations:

        • The checkpoint has no defined parent RunnableEntity;
        • The checkpoint has not a set MemoryZone or it is not usable;
        • The checkpoint was never updated and there is no saved state to copy;
        • There is an active update process which is modifying the checkpoint (see isCheckpointStateSet(byte));
        • The given zone is the same as the Checkpoint's MemoryZone (see getMemoryZone());
        • The given zone is not usable;
        • Other implementation-specific reasons that may prevent the copy.
        Parameters:
        zone - the MemoryZone where to copy the checkpoint
        Returns:
        true if the checkpoint can be copied to the given zone

      • canCopy

        boolean canCopy()
        Same as canCopy(MemoryZone), but does not make any tests relative to the MemoryZone where the checkpoint will be copied.
        Returns:
        true if the copy is possible using this checkpoint given a valid MemoryZone.

      • copy

        void copy(MemoryZone zone)
        Create a copy of the checkpoint using another MemoryZone.

        This method returns immediately, you need to listen to appropriate notification codes to know when the checkpoint have been copied.

        During the copy, the state CHECKPOINT_STATE_COPYING is set. Once the copy is finished, either a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_COPY_SUCCESS notification or a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_COPY_ERROR notification is thrown depending on if the copy process was successful or not.

        Parameters:
        zone - the MemoryZone where to copy the checkpoint
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if canCopy(MemoryZone) returns false

      • cancelCopy

        void cancelCopy()
        Cancels an ongoing copy.

        You need to listen to appropriate notifications to know when the copy is completed (canceled or succeeded)

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the checkpoint is not being copied (see isCheckpointStateSet(byte))

      • canDelete

        boolean canDelete()
        Returns true if the checkpoint can be deleted.

        This method returns false in the following situations:

        • There is an active process which is using the checkpoint (see isCheckpointBusy());
        • Other implementation-specific reasons that may prevent the deletion.
        Returns:
        true if the checkpoint can be deleted

      • delete

        void delete()
        Deletes the checkpoint.

        This method will reduce the size of the MemoryZone used by the checkpoint to zero.
        The parent and the MemoryZone of the checkpoint are not modified.

        After deleting the checkpoint, it will no longer be usable by the update(), recover(Entity, RunnableEntity) or copy(MemoryZone) methods.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if canDelete() returns false

      • getCheckpointingHandler

        CheckpointingHandler<E,? extends Checkpoint<E,P>> getCheckpointingHandler()
        Returns the CheckpointingHandler that has created this checkpoint or null if this checkpoint was not created by a CheckpointingHandler.
        Returns:
        the CheckpointingHandler that has created this checkpoint or null
        See Also:
        setCheckpointingHandler(CheckpointingHandler)

      • setCheckpointingHandler

        void setCheckpointingHandler(CheckpointingHandler<E,? extends Checkpoint<E,P>> ch)
        Updates the CheckpointingHandler associated with this checkpoint.
        Parameters:
        ch -
